trans-unit.source: This section explains how to share data between Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, including how to use the Share contract, copy and paste, and drag and drop.
trans-unit.target: This section explains how to share data between Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, including how to use the Share contract, copy and paste, and drag and drop.

trans-unit.source: App-to-app communication
trans-unit.target: App-to-app communication

trans-unit.source: App-to-app communication
trans-unit.target: App-to-app communication

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: This section explains how to share data between Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, including how to use the Share contract, copy and paste, and drag and drop.
trans-unit.target: This section explains how to share data between Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, including how to use the Share contract, copy and paste, and drag and drop.

trans-unit.source: The Share contract is one way users can quickly exchange data between apps.
trans-unit.target: The Share contract is one way users can quickly exchange data between apps.

trans-unit.source: For example, a user might want to share a webpage with their friends using a social networking app, or save a link in a notes app to refer to later.
trans-unit.target: For example, a user might want to share a webpage with their friends using a social networking app, or save a link in a notes app to refer to later.

trans-unit.source: Consider using a Share contract if your app receives content in scenarios that a user can quickly complete while in the context of another app.
trans-unit.target: Consider using a Share contract if your app receives content in scenarios that a user can quickly complete while in the context of another app.

trans-unit.source: An app can support the Share feature in two ways.
trans-unit.target: An app can support the Share feature in two ways.

trans-unit.source: First, it can be a source app that provides content that the user wants to share.
trans-unit.target: First, it can be a source app that provides content that the user wants to share.

trans-unit.source: Second, the app can be a target app that the user selects as the destination for shared content.
trans-unit.target: Second, the app can be a target app that the user selects as the destination for shared content.

trans-unit.source: An app can also be both a source app and a target app.
trans-unit.target: An app can also be both a source app and a target app.

trans-unit.source: If you want your app to share content as a source app, you need to decide what data formats your app can provide.
trans-unit.target: If you want your app to share content as a source app, you need to decide what data formats your app can provide.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the Share contract, apps can also integrate classic techniques for transferring data, such as dragging and dropping or copy and pasting.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the Share contract, apps can also integrate classic techniques for transferring data, such as dragging and dropping or copy and pasting.

trans-unit.source: In addition to communication between UWP apps, these methods also support sharing to and from desktop applications.
trans-unit.target: In addition to communication between UWP apps, these methods also support sharing to and from desktop applications.

trans-unit.source: Description

trans-unit.source: Share data
trans-unit.target: Share data

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to support the Share contract in a UWP app.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to support the Share contract in a UWP app.

trans-unit.source: The Share contract is an easy way to quickly share data, such as text, links, photos, and videos, between apps.
trans-unit.target: The Share contract is an easy way to quickly share data, such as text, links, photos, and videos, between apps.

trans-unit.source: For example, a user might want to share a webpage with their friends using a social networking app, or save a link in a notes app to refer to later.
trans-unit.target: For example, a user might want to share a webpage with their friends using a social networking app, or save a link in a notes app to refer to later.

trans-unit.source: Receive data
trans-unit.target: Receive data

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to receive content in your UWP app shared from another app using Share contract.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to receive content in your UWP app shared from another app using Share contract.

trans-unit.source: This Share contract allows your app to be presented as an option when the user invokes Share.
trans-unit.target: This Share contract allows your app to be presented as an option when the user invokes Share.

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to support copy and paste in UWP apps using the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to support copy and paste in UWP apps using the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste is the classic way to exchange data either between apps, or within an app, and almost every app can support clipboard operations to some degree.
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste is the classic way to exchange data either between apps, or within an app, and almost every app can support clipboard operations to some degree.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to add dragging and dropping in your UWP app.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to add dragging and dropping in your UWP app.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop is a classic, natural way of interacting with content such as images and files.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop is a classic, natural way of interacting with content such as images and files.

trans-unit.source: Once implemented, drag and drop works seamlessly in all directions, including app-to-app, app-to-desktop, and desktop-to app.
trans-unit.target: Once implemented, drag and drop works seamlessly in all directions, including app-to-app, app-to-desktop, and desktop-to app.
